intro: Anplectrum patens, commonly known as the slender marsh orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in North America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has narrow, linear leaves that are often submerged or floating in water. Its roots are adapted to aquatic environments, allowing it to thrive in shallow, still waters. Anplectrum patens plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
